summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Sixty-fourth Street, from Twenty-second Avenue Northwest to Twenty-sixth Avenue Northwest, all in The City of Seattle., by resurfacing and curbing the same, and by constructing concrete sidewalks and wooden crosswalks thereon, and providing for the necessary surface drainage, all in accordance with Resolution No. 2944 of the City Council of The City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle.
